pullRequest.body:
We add `Data.Set.Subset` to the set of files ignored by the shake linter, which gives a false positive when this file is just imported for the notation.

---

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

It seems a bit odd to me that we would be `noshake`ing an entire file just because some notation is defined there. Perhaps a better solution could be to separate out the notation into its own file and `noshake` that?

> It seems a bit odd to me that we would be `noshake`ing an entire file just because some notation is defined there. Perhaps a better solution could be to separate out the notation into its own file and `noshake` that?

I've just done this - a new file `Data.Set.Notation` now contains the `â†“âˆ©` notation as well as the `â†‘s` notation for `(â†‘) '' s`, both scoped to `Set.Notation` as before. The impact is minimal.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9745282192/job/26892822735)
